amendment.description: To reinstate for millionaires a top individual income tax rate of 39.6 percent, the pre-May 2003 rates of tax on capital gains and dividends, and to repeal the reduction and termination of the phase out of personal exemptions and overall limitation on itemized deductions, until the Federal budget deficit is eliminated.

action.text: Amendment SA 2610 ruled out of order by the chair.
Motion to waive the Budget Act with respect to amendment SA 2610 rejected in Senate by Yea-Nay Vote. 40 - 59. Record Vote Number: 333.
Point of order raised in Senate with respect to amendment SA 2610.

Amendment SA 2610 proposed by Senator Feinstein. (consideration: CR S13081-13085, S13089-13090, S13102-13103; text: CR S13082) To reinstate for millionaires a top individual income tax rate of 39.6 percent, the pre-May 2003 rates of tax on capital gains and dividends, and to repeal the reduction and termination of the phase out of personal exemptions and overall limitation on itemized deductions, until the Federal budget deficit is eliminated.
